intro: Erigeron pinnatisectus var. insolens, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of white and yellow. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and disturbed soils. It is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes many common garden flowers. This variety is distinguished by its narrow, pinnatisected leaves and is often found in the western United States.
